Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder are riding a franchise-record 14-game winning streak, while the Celtics are the defending NBA champions.

During the winning streak, the Celtics are shooting 51.6 percent from the floor and have posted a 133.6 offensive rating — points scored per 100 possessions — and a 103.3 defensive rating. Both marks are best in the NBA over that span.
Oklahoma City has the NBA’s best defense, with a 102.9 defensive rating.
Gilgeous-Alexander is averaging 32.7 points, 5.2 assists, 5.2 rebounds, 2.3 steals and 1.2 blocks during the winning streak.
Porzingis returned Friday after missing four games with a left ankle sprain.
Jaylen Brown has missed the last two games with a shoulder strain while Al Horford figures to return Sunday after missing Friday’s win due to rest on the second night of a back-to-back.
